content.description: This is the bulgy scoop like slab.  It starts with the two polished slopers, and there some good feet if you look around.  Mantle onto the slab and walk it out.
content.location: This route is located directly to the right of Eagle slab, and directly behind Blues Crack.

content.description: Climb a short vertical wall via crimps to the top.  Rail on the right is off.
content.location: The Glove Area.  To the right of Blues Crack.

content.description: Stand start on edges. The crux comes down to an exciting move that requires strong fingers,  flexible hips, and a small foot. Unique boulder for the area.
content.location: This boulder is located 10 feet right of Tough Guy slab.

content.description: Start on eagle slab and move up the arete to the left (good side pull on the left of the arete close to the top) top out just left of eagle slab
content.protection: a few pads are nice. better to look where you are falling than to rely on spotters, a few rocks at the bottom...
content.location: in the glove area start on eagle slab and move left

content.description: Textured slab somewhat friction dependent.  Though easier than Sleazy slab and many others.
content.location: Tall textured slab located in the Glove area.  It is on the same boulder as Eagle and Zen slab.  This is the line you will see if you enter from the Lake trail looking at this side of the boulder.

content.description: Climb short vert wall with crimps, off a small rail left of crack.
Tricky short slab.  Much easier on colder days.  There are some textured hands and feet holds but its mainly friction climbing.
content.location: This is one of the slabs in the Glove area.  It is directly as you walk in on the left, if you are coming in from the lake trail.  It is opposite side of the rock from Easy Glove Slab.

content.description: Strat on opposing side jugs on each side of Arête, throw to top and make odd mantle.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter beside tree.
content.location: Off dirt road trail just past Glove sign.

content.description: Start the crack from the left or dig right in.  Very thin at the beginning and opens up and easier at the top.
content.location: This route is the well known crack in the Glove area, commonly mistaken for the Glove.  The Glove area can be reached by following signs from the parking lot.

content.description: Climb rounded feature scumming, slapping and heel hooking straight up.
content.location: if you are standing back to blues crack, you are looking directly at it.

content.description: Start on the face to the right of Blues Crack by using two side pulls in an position like the iron cross. Step up on to small edges for your feet and keep squeezing till you get to the top. Keep yout feet on the face and resist the urge to go left into Blues Crack.
content.location: The Glove area. Hang a right at the Spiderman Boulder.

content.description: Climb a short vertical wall via crimps to a slopey top out.  Crack is off.
Find good foot on long blank tube surrounded by lichen.  Mantle
content.location: In glove area 10’ right of Low Crack

content.description: Hit "Improve This Page" to submit a description!
